title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [4 november 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [4 November 1868]
text: Evening 4 Nov. 1868wensdayWednesdayDear Walti got your letter to day wensdayWednesday all safe and one from HeydHeyde saying hannaHannahh was sick i dontdon't know what to make out by the letter but i should think she was better he says he had telegraph to you i wish i could know the thruthtruth about her) it made me feel bad with my other afflictions but i hope to stand it some how or other mattyMatty is i dontdon't know what to say the doctor has sounded her lungs and said they were not as bad as he first thought but she is not able to doodo much but i hope she will be better the doctor pays good attention to her has given her somthingsomething for her coughfcough to take when she has bad spelsspells mrMr. OconerO'Connor was here awhile to day but wouldntwouldn't have any dinner or lunch said he had just had his breakfast) Ellen price was here last saturdaySaturday she didendidn't stay long she had lost her purse and i let her have some change to go home with they had hired their rooms to a man and wife and 2 little boys the stears sSteers's have moved in to day so we have had a pretty jolly noise but its good to have something to keep up a little excitement but the best of all is grant is elected good bie walterWalter dear i wrote this in a hurry as you see Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [4 November 1868]
